page.title: 07MINCINGFIELD FARM-CHANGES
page.content: The EEC and government grants play and important role in the farmer's decisions on these farms. Not long ago they built a cattle shed for which they received a large grant. The farmer admitted that the shed would not be as large and complex without the grant. The land farmed is very wet which gives low grass yields of 2 tons per field instead of 3. This is due to the clay content of the soil which causes water to lie on the surface of the land Many jobs have been lost on the farm due to mechanisation and todays farming methods are less labour intensive. A small crew of men run the two farms.
